string.text: Ohhh, what is wrong with me? My head hurts so much... And who are you?
I'm the one who wants to ask you that: who are you, handsome, and where did you come from wearing only a sweater?
I... I don't remember... There was a flash... Then a complete blackout.
If you want to live, use your brain and remember quickly. If I think you're lying, I'll shoot you.

Wait! Don't shoot! All I remember is that yesterday evening my older brother, his friends, and I went on a bus excursion to see the "Dead City". They told so many interesting things about the Ghost City that we decided to get here ourselves. We wanted some thrills, wanted to play paintball in the ruins with the guys, and we took all the necessary gear with us. There were ten other people with us... In the center of the city, we were supposed to meet a guide-instructor with whom we had agreed in advance by phone. But when we drove through the gates, suddenly something flashed, blinded us and... I don't remember anything else.

What damn excursion, what paintball! Stop feeding me bullshit. This has been a closed territory for a long time, the very center of the Zone: deadly anomalies and crowds of mutants, may they all burn in hell... And the last excursion here was about 3 years ago.

How can that be? I'm telling the truth! We just yesterday... On the bus with my brother and the guys... We paid the driver 2000 hryvnias to take us here along the abandoned road... And where are all the others? What is happening, huh?

Uhhh, buddy, it seems your head is really not okay. The last time tourists were brought here was in 2008. In the autumn, I think. I was moonlighting as a guide here back then. Until that second explosion at the CNPP happened. And then another powerful emission, and everything started... damn it... Three years have passed, but I remember it like it was yesterday. This nightmare...
So what year is it now, huh?

Today is October 5, 2011... Alright, let's stop chatting! I don't know why, but I believed your delirium. Perhaps the Zone really played a "cruel joke" on you, poor fellow. If so, then you got hit right by that same emission, and for some reason, the Zone "spared" you... just like it spared me back then... If only I knew why... Anyway: forget everything you told me, and don't tell anyone else about it. This is the Zone, and there are enough "miracles" here without you... Now let's do this: come with me, you need to get your head straight, and it's too dangerous to stay here for long.
Where are we going? And who are you?

I am Forester. A hermit... We'll go to the Red Forest, to my humble abode. It's not far. We need to discuss everything slowly, what is happening here. I have a feeling of some strange deja vu... Okay, questions later. Well, are you ready to go? Just don't lag behind, but don't get ahead of me either. Walk next to me, or better yet, follow in my footsteps so you don't step into anything. The main thing now is to get out of this godforsaken place into the Forest, and from there it's a stone's throw to my humble shelter. Here, I'll give you a flashlight, binoculars, and my old knife. It's better than nothing.
Thank you. Well, it seems I have no other choice... Let's go, I won't lag behind.
Forester, what is dangerous in this city?

Firstly, deadly anomalies. I hope you noticed them while we were walking. Besides that, mutants. They are called pseudodogs. One of the many sinister spawns of the Zone. This place is full of them, especially at night. We were lucky not to meet any of them today. Also, after emissions, zombies appear. Where they come from is unclear, but there are plenty of them here.
I see. Well, are we there yet?
Yes, behind me are the old gates, that's the transition to the Forest. All right, you go first now, I'll follow you.
Okay, I'm going.
So this is where you live?

Yes, this is where I while away my days and nights. I go into the Forest, sometimes visit the Dead City. I gather various roots, artifacts, and then trade them with scientists for medicine and food. That's how I live quietly, away from everyone. Well, let's talk about you now. It's extremely strange that I found you in the Dead City. How did you end up there?.. Some kind of mysticism, by God. I visit that place once a week.
Well, I'm telling you, I don't understand how it happened. I told you everything I remember!
Okay, okay, don't worry so much. Listen to me now. I think you said the last thing you remember is arriving at the Dead City with your older brother and his friends on a bus, right?
Yes, exactly. And I have no idea what happened to him and the other guys. And I don't understand what happened to me either. And for some reason, the last thing I remember was three years ago...
I don't know what happened to the others, but it seems I can tell you something about your brother.
Why did you stay silent the whole way then? I asked you if you knew anything or not!

Don't make noise, too much time has passed since that day. And your story smacks too much of some devilry. Anyway, listen further. Three years ago, as I told you, the second explosion at the CNPP happened, and then there was a powerful emission. Most of those who were within the radius, including in the Dead City, died. I managed to survive by hiding in the basement of a high-rise building. When I came out two days later, I didn't recognize the place where I worked as a guide for tourists and curious people like you. Everything suddenly changed and became... I can't even explain it properly. Well, basically, as if not 2 days passed, but twenty or thirty years...
So what happened next?

And then I realized I needed to get out of there urgently. Without special equipment, I wouldn't have survived. The radiation level was quite high. I went out into the city and rushed to the nearest building, where I found you too. I look: aside, on the floor lies a guy and seems to be moving. I go up to him, check his pulse and sure enough - alive! I somehow brought him to his senses, hauled him on myself and rushed to the Forest. That guy looked very much like you. I assume it was your brother. Already here he told me how he ended up where I found him. His story repeats yours, that's why I believed you. He introduced himself as "Captain".

Yes, that's correct. It was my brother. We invented calling each other that since childhood: he was "Captain", and I was "Strelok". Our childhood nicknames later grew into names that our friends started calling us. Well, so what happened to my brother? Where is he now?

He lived with me for about a month, helped settle the dwelling, grieved greatly over the loss of friends and brother... He kept trying to go searching. He was brave, but understood that it was impossible to go to the Dead City then - certain death. Once we gathered and reached almost the exit from the Forest, but heard howling and screams of some monsters and decided not to risk it for now. After the second explosion, the Zone appeared in the form in which it remains to this day: mutated animals and deadly anomalies, artifacts with unprecedented properties and constant emissions, changing and reshaping the Zone after each time stronger and stronger. God forbid you meet the creatures inhabiting closer to the center of the Zone. \n\nAnd your brother left later anyway... Five people came to our dig, called themselves Stalkers, looking for valuable artifacts for sale in the formed Zone. "Captain" left with them, hoping to find you and the other friends. As I see, he didn't succeed... He didn't appear anymore. Only once, six months later, I heard from scientists who came to study the Zone and mutants and set up camp near Lake Yantar, that a group of daredevils went to the Sarcophagus in search of valuable artifacts and to unravel the mystery of the Zone's origin. Among them, apparently, was a stalker nicknamed "Captain". That's all I know about it.

Thank you for what you told me. It means there is still hope to find my brother's trail or him himself. I must find him. Or, at least, find out what happened to him during this time. Maybe he is still looking for me too. If you need help with anything, speak, I'll do everything.
You look gloomy, father.
Yes, a problem appeared while you were away.
What happened?

A courier from the ecologists was supposed to come to me yesterday, bring medicine and food, and in return take various roots and several artifacts that I collected for the scientists over the last week. But yesterday another sudden emission happened, and I decided that he just didn't leave the camp. I thought he would wait out the emission there and come in a day or two. But turns out, he was already walking to me when the emission started. While you were going for the Mandrake root, he contacted me by radio. True, the reception was bad. From what I heard, I only understood that he hid from the emission in the southern part of the forest. And while he was looking for that shelter, he ran into mutants and barely escaped. Now he is afraid to leave there, and he lost the map of the Forest while running from the beasts. He asks me to come to him.
Well, that means we need to go and rescue the man.

We need to go, but my heart seized up even more. Lately, my health is really bad. And the courier was bringing me medicine from the scientists... Listen, son, help an old man out, find this ecologist, help him get here with the medicine and food, and I'll lie down here for a while, maybe the pain will let go. Yes, this courier's name is Docent Vasiliev. I'll put a mark on the map for you. Look for him near the big boulders, beware of anomalies and mutants. And here, take a medkit, bandages, and a couple of packs of buckshot, just in case.
Understood, I'll go find Docent Vasiliev.
Are you okay, intact? Didn't expect such bravery from a scientist! You have a dangerous job here.

I seem to be intact. We need to go to our Bunker, rest there. At the same time, you'll meet Professor Sakharov. He is our chief. He will issue you more medicine for Forester, which I couldn't deliver. And you'll meet Dan and his "eagles". That's our security. For helping me, a reward awaits you. I'll put in a good word with Sakharov. And when we get to the Bunker, find Dan immediately, introduce yourself. He is the head of security for the scientific base after all.
Okay, let's go visit you, for a short while. I'll pick up the medicine for Forester at the same time.
Greetings! You must be Dan - the head of the scientists' base security?
Yes, that's me. Thank you, Stalker, for helping Vasiliev get out of the Forest and reach here.

Don't mention it. And I'm not a fighter at all. I ended up here by accident. I need to pick up medicine for Forester from Sakharov. Vasiliev said I should come to you first. And I have a question: I must find my brother, or at least find out what happened to him. We lost each other several years ago under very strange circumstances. But that's a long story... Have you by chance met a man who called himself "Captain"? He looks very much like me? Since childhood, many even confused us, although my brother is 2 years older than me.

We all ended up here by accident to one degree or another... I haven't met a man looking like you nicknamed "Captain", and we ourselves haven't been here long, about a year. You'd better ask Sakharov - he is the chief among local scientists, a professor, and has been in the Zone practically from the very beginning, met and knows many people. And one more thing: we really need brave fighters, join us in "Clear Sky", serve for the good of science.
No, I can't. I need to go back to the Forest, to Forester. I promised to return to him, need to bring medicines. And I'm in his debt. He saved me and led me out of the Dead City.
Okay, as you wish, decide for yourself. But if you change your mind, come to us.
Okay, I'll think about it. Tell me, how do I get back to the Forest from here?

Only Sakharov can tell you that. When he needs to send one of his employees to the Forest accompanied by a couple of my guys, he always very carefully calculates the safest route using his devices. So go to him. Get the reward for helping Vasiliev and ask about your brother at the same time.
Okay, I'll go to Sakharov.
Good day, Professor.
Yes, yes, I'm waiting for you, dear sir. You are due a reward for the help provided to us.
No, I'm not here for the reward, but for the medicine for Forester. And I also need to find out something from you.

Well, young man, one shouldn't refuse a reward. Here, take this from us in gratitude. And I will try to answer your questions. Especially since the medicine will be ready only in a few minutes, so we can talk a little.
Thank you, Professor.
I have two questions for you, Professor.
Speak, I'm listening attentively.
I am looking for my brother, who should be somewhere in the Zone. We missed each other several years ago, if you can call it that. In the Dead City. And under very strange circumstances.
So, and what was your brother's name? Any distinguishing marks?

He always called himself "Captain", that's how he introduced himself to Forester too. Forester found him, like me, three years ago in the "Dead City", sheltered him for some time. Then my brother went to look for me, and Forester hasn't met him since. And his marks are very simple. My brother and I are like two drops of water, like twins. Although he is two years older than me and a bit taller. The only thing is he has a large mole above his upper lip, right in the middle.

You know, young man, I recall that exactly about two years, maybe two and a half years ago, a stalker nicknamed "Captain" came to me. He and several other people came to our Bunker together to stock up on scientific medkits and powerful anti-radiation drugs before a big trip to the center of the Zone. These were some of the first brave stalkers who were not afraid and went to the Sarcophagus in the very heart of the Zone to learn the main secret. Unfortunately, I haven't heard anything more about the fate of the participants of this daring expedition. Rumor had it that they did reach the Sarcophagus and made their way inside. But I have no other information about this.

Thank you, Professor. At least something became known. I will definitely find out about the fate of this expedition and what happened to my brother. And the second question: how can I get back to the Forest? I need to return to Forester.

As you probably already know, in the Zone you cannot walk the same road twice. The Zone constantly changes, and one has to look for and calculate new routes, find new paths to move. More or less stable transitions exist only in some places, for example, in the territory of the Bar, Agroprom, Garbage, and Cordon. But I can help you. You can get to the Forest from Yantar, I marked the path in your PDA. Give my regards to Forester. And here is the medicine for him, which Vasiliev failed to deliver. And with food, young man, things are tight for us right now. You and the grandfather will have to be patient. Tell Forester that we'll pick up the artifacts and roots next time, in a week, when the courier brings provisions.
Understood. I'll go find this Secret Path leading to the Forest.
I'm back. Sorry it took so long. Vasiliev simply lost your package when running away from monsters. Had to go with him to Yantar and pick up new medicine from Sakharov.
Yeah, lately everything is going terribly wrong. Bad luck everywhere. Anyway, give me the medicine and grub, because I feel really bad with my heart. I thought I wouldn't wait for you anymore.
Here, take the medicine quickly. But with food, the eggheads are tight right now, asked to wait a week.
Father, where are we going to get provisions now? I see your supplies are running low.

We'll have to come up with something... I have a small box hidden in a secluded place. For a rainy day, so to speak. Well, apparently, this day has come. You'll have to go and get the box. True, you'll have to go to the Dead City.
Give me the coordinates, I'll go.

Eh, I don't want to let you go alone, but, apparently, I have to. Listen to me carefully: I made the stash in the School building. This building has columns, just not far from the place where I found you. I was actually going to this stash. But I had to get distracted by you, Strelok. While bringing you to senses, time ran out. Had to leave quickly. Look for the stash on the first floor. Understood everything? As soon as you take the provisions, come back immediately and don't linger there!.. Oh, my sick heart senses something wrong. But there is nothing to do, must go. Here, take more buckshot just in case and a medkit.
Don't worry, Father, I'll be careful. Alright, I'm going.
Father, I got delayed again, sorry. An unforeseen situation happened there.
Strelok, I was very worried about you. Thought dogs tore you apart. What else happened there, tell me.

In the Dead City, in the School building, tenants appeared. Call themselves "Wanderers". Their leader is Leila. A tough woman, but beautiful. At first, they almost killed me, then it was okay. Turned out to be normal guys. They found your stash... I helped them a little. They gave me the box with the remains of provisions. In addition, gave me an assault rifle and a protective suit. And Leila also said that one of their people should return from a raid soon, who can help me in search of my brother.
It's good that you found friends. You can't be bored here with an old man forever. Who knows, maybe they really will help you find your brother... Well, show me what provisions we have there.
There's still half a box, enough for a week or two if we tighten our belts a bit. Here, take the box.
And who are you?
I'd ask you to be polite, don't look for trouble, stalker. What are you doing here? Answer short and clear.
Okay, okay, don't worry. I came here at the request of a man just to pick up provisions from a stash.
What fool thought of making a stash in this godforsaken place?
It's not a fool - it's Forester. Do you know him?

I heard about Forester. Seems like a good man... Okay, let's go to our base now. Leila will deal with you there. She is our leader, you can't fool her! Just watch out, walk next to me. Try to run - you'll get a bullet. If you move further than ten meters away, it will be considered an escape attempt. Understood?
Yes, understood, I understood. Let's go.
Good day.
Well, speak. Who are you and what did you come to the Dead City with. Just don't be shady.

My name is Strelok. I came here on Forester's errand to pick up provisions from his stash. He couldn't come himself, his heart is bad. I actually live with Forester now, help him. Just that food is tight now. So he sent me to bring the box with food from his stash.
Well, I know Forester well... And where is his stash hidden?
Well, I see I need to be completely frank with you. You are serious guys. Forester's stash, according to his description, is in this building on the first floor.

Now I believe you. Because we already found this box with provisions. Your Forester hid it poorly. Probably thought no one walks here. He was wrong. Now our Skete is here, and we are "Wanderers". Heard anything about us? Forester didn't tell you anything?

No, haven't heard anything about you before. And Forester didn't tell me anything. I'm actually quite new to the Zone. Forester found me under strange circumstances. I'm looking for my brother now. Have you heard anything about a stalker nicknamed "Captain"? He looks very much like me.

No, Strelok, I don't know such a person and haven't heard anything about him. We've been in the Zone for only a year and a half ourselves, and during this time, except for enemies and envious people, we haven't met anyone. And we don't particularly strive to make acquaintances here. We have other goals. Although, whoever comes to us with good, receives good from us.
I see. And what are you doing in the Zone?

We are here unofficially carrying out a mission for a large scientific company. You don't need to know more. We have a peaceful mission, but sometimes we have to shoot. Too many surprises in the Zone. Must be constantly on guard and fully armed. By the way, if you want to buy some provisions, equipment, or weapons, talk to "Mozart" - he is our "supply manager". By the way, he was the one who found your Forester's stash. Understood everything?
Yes, everything is clear to me.
Tell me, what about Forester's box now?

It's very simple: we don't need what's not ours. But we found the stash ourselves. Now this is our territory and everything on it also belongs to the "Wanderers" brotherhood. And I will give you Forester's box, but only on the condition that you help us with one matter.
Okay, I'll work for the provisions. What needs to be done?

It's simple, Strelok. Now go to Demon, he is our head of security. Find him in the former store building, near the Lenin monument. We are currently conducting an operation to clean the city territory from all scum. You will help us with this. Basically, Demon will tell you everything and give you an automatic weapon with ammo. And at the same time, we'll check what kind of "shooter" you are. I'll warn Demon about you.
Okay, going to Demon.
I fulfilled your condition. Give me Forester's box.

You really are a brave fellow, Strelok. We, Wanderers, keep our word. Take your box. True, we already took something from there, so let Forester not be offended. Should have hidden it better. And come by if you have a chance. We honor and respect brave people. And one more thing: about your business regarding your brother... We have one Wanderer in the team, called "Grig". He has been in the Zone for a long time, joined us from the very beginning of our mission. He was a guide, and then joined our ranks for good. He is on a mission right now, but should return soon. And you can find out about your brother from him. Perhaps he knows something. As soon as he returns, I will inform Forester on the radio.
Good, I will wait impatiently to meet him. And how do I get back to the Forest now?
Go to the sentry who brought you to me. He is waiting for you near the entrance to this room and will tell you everything. Without him, you won't find the path to the Forest.
Aha, understood. I'll go talk to him.
Greetings, chief!
What chief am I to you?
Okay, okay, don't boil over. Leila told me that you will show me where the path is that will lead me to the Forest.
I'll show you, daredevil. Follow me, when we reach the post, then I'll upload the marker of the transition to the Forest to your PDA. Don't lag behind.
Understood, let's go.
Greetings. Are you Demon?
Yes that's me, Strelok. Leila warned me about you. Ready for exploits?
Always ready! What needs to be done?

We don't control the whole city yet. The houses are full of zombies. They constantly appear after emissions... Where do they come from? Now, after the last emission, my guys already cleared most of it, but one five-story building remains. The last one, the one next to the corner five-story building with a broken roof. That's where, in one of the entrances, there is full of scum. Zombies are slow, but it's better not to let them close. You'll go alone, my guys are extremely exhausted by the last raid. Show what you are capable of. Here, take an assault rifle and four packs of ammo for it. And be careful there, don't ask for trouble.
Understood everything. Going to fight the scum.
I cleared that house of zombies.
Well done, Strelok! Keep the assault rifle as a reward.
Thank you. I'll go to Leila and pick up what she promised to return to me.
Listen, Forester. The Wanderers have a trader, called Mozart...
Looking to buy something you spotted?
Yes, I spotted something. He has many useful things and good weapons. And most importantly, he sells ammo cheaply. But where can I get money, huh?

Well, I can offer you a way to earn. The scientists from Yantar pay very well for various roots and artifacts. Especially valued by them, as you already realized, is the Mandrake root, which you obtained for me recently. They prepare a protective potion from it. They want to penetrate some laboratory, where brains supposedly "boil" from some powerful, unknown scientific impact. So they constantly offer me big money for every root I find. They don't really want to search themselves, and can't, honestly speaking. And Mandrake grows only here, in the Forest, in places where not everyone would guess to look. And why do I need money? I trade what I find for provisions and buckshot for my double-barreled gun.
So, interesting. And how much can one earn from this?
They pay fifteen thousand for each root. Considerable money... I can tell you where to find more roots.
Go ahead, tell me!

Alright then. I know where to find three Mandrakes. Only the scientists won't take them from you. They overinsure themselves greatly. They will sell or exchange roots only with me personally. I have money. Two months ago I collected a large amount of roots and artifacts for the scientists. They not only gave provisions but insisted I take money. So now it lies idle. And I see you need it more. Just giving it away is wrong, but earning it is the right thing. So, do we have a deal?
Of course, we have a deal. Tell me where to search for the plants.

Right here behind the fence, there is an old abandoned mine. Mandrake should be growing there. Find three roots and bring them to me, and I'll give you the money - 45 thousand. I'll also give you some buckshot and a medkit. Just be careful there!
Understood. I'm going.
Forester, I brought three roots!
What a good fellow! To be honest, I'm afraid to climb into that mine alone.
And rightly so. There are some flying creatures there. Horror! And as soon as I took the last, third root, a monster appeared. A hypnotist or something. Barely got out of there.

Flying creatures are poltergeists. They are cowardly but dangerous if you run into them nose to nose. And the hypnotist is a Controller. That one is scarier than a pack of boars. A treacherous beast. Okay, give me the roots and take your honestly earned money. And go rest.
Here are the roots, take them. I'll go for a walk. My hands are still shaking.
Well, father? Any news while I was climbing mines?
Leila informed me that the very person you are waiting for has appeared. So you have to go to the City again, son... Apparently, we won't see each other soon now...
Come on, father, don't grieve. We got provisions, we have roots! And I won't be long. Just find out about my brother and return. Soon, I hope.
Okay, Strelok, don't worry about me. Go to Leila, she is waiting for you. You know the secret path from the Forest to the Dead City.
See you, father, I will definitely return!
Greetings, soldier!
Don't distract me. Go to the Skete, you know the way.
See you.
Greetings, Sister!
Don't be a smartass! What sister am I to you? I thought you had a brother?
That's what I came for. You informed Forester that your guide appeared, who might be able to help me. Is that so?
Yes, he arrived recently from a raid to the Swamps. We have a checkpoint there, and Grig is in charge there. But before you go to him, I will ask you to help with one simple matter.
What matter?

You see, a gang of marauders constantly hangs around in the Dead City. Just homeless kids. Thugs, of course, but still children. They rummage through abandoned houses, take out everything they find for sale. But recently a leader appeared among them, someone named Razuvaev. A former criminal. With his arrival, things got serious. The gang now not only quietly robs abandoned houses and shops in the district but also kills. Just recently, they robbed and killed one of our brothers returning from a raid. We staged a raid on them, but to no avail.
So how can I help you? You have your own small army.

That's true, but it's a delicate matter... My soldiers swore to catch and destroy everyone. Demon even set a reward for Razuvaev's head - 100,000 rubles. For the others, the order is: Destroy on the spot without trial or investigation. I cannot and do not want to interfere and violate the laws of the "Wanderers". But despite all this, I don't want unnecessary, useless deaths. I'm not ready to take on the sin of fighting children, even if they are criminals. Do you understand me?
Yes, I understand. So what do you want from me?

According to my information, the marauder leader Razuvaev left the Dead City for a while with a group of hardened killers and criminals. A small group of teenagers led by a kid nicknamed Maloy remained here. I want you to quietly find this gang and convey my demands to them. Don't be afraid, they are thugs, but not killers. They are unlikely to shoot first at a lone Stalker.
Okay. And what conditions should I convey to them, and where to find them?

The conditions are simple: I pass them twenty thousand rubles through you. For them, this is good money, and in return, they tell everything they know about their leader: who he is, where he comes from, where he usually sets up camps, and so on. And then let them leave the Dead City and never appear here again. Otherwise, Demon's fighters will shoot them. I will mark their suspected camp location on the map for you. Just please: not a word to anyone, otherwise the boys are done for. Understood?
Yes, I understood everything. Mark the map, give the money, and I'll try to negotiate with your "kids".
Are you Maloy?
Well, I am. And who are you, uncle?
Doesn't matter. Leila sent me to you. Know her?
The chieftess? Yeah, I know. Does she want to invite young boys for a visit?
Idiot! She offers you a deal to save your useless lives.
And you are, like, a messenger of goodwill? Is that it? And what does our "savior" offer?

You are laughing in vain, young man. The "Wanderers" are preparing a raid on you for your "wet work". So you don't really have a choice. And Leila's offer to you is this: she gives you twenty thousand rubles. You tell about Razuvaev, who he is and where to find him, and then get the hell out of here forever. Otherwise, you are dead. Choose.
Okay, I'm not stupid, I get it. I need to talk it over with the gang.
Okay, I'll wait.
Well, have you decided?

Listen, uncle, we agree. Only we don't know much about Razuvaev. I only know that he escaped from prison and gathered a gang here in the Zone and scavenges little by little. We ended up with him by accident, had nowhere to go, so we started doing petty work for him. And we have nothing to do with his "wet work", keep in mind! I don't know where to look for him either. They say his main camp is somewhere in an abandoned village, not far from the "Glubokaya" station, in the south of the Zone.
Okay, I'll take your word for it. So, you take the money and get out of here, did I understand correctly?

Yes, right, right. Don't rush the horses. Give the money. Then step away from this place about 50 meters behind the bushes so you don't see which way we leave. Conspiracy, chief, understand? We won't come back here, I swear.
Okay, here, take the promised money. I'll step away 50 meters. Then I'll come back, check. There better be no trace of you here. If you tricked me, I'll personally shoot you to hell.
Well, I dealt with the marauders.
So, you managed to persuade them and they left?

Yes, they left. Promised not to return here anymore. Impudent guys. Young, green still, but daring. Accepted your conditions, took the money. They don't really know anything about their leader Razuvaev. Say he went deep into the Zone with a group of experienced ones. Seemed to plan to return to the Dead City soon, but no news from him yet. Seemed like Razuvaev's main camp is somewhere in an abandoned village, near Station "Glubokoe", in the south of the Zone.

Good. I hope these young idiots have enough brains not to come here again. Thank you, Strelok. Now it's time to go to Grig. Talk to him, because he is getting ready to go back soon. He is located not far from here, in the former Party Committee building. And as for the marauder leader, we'll catch him yet. The time will come. If you suddenly meet this little reptile Razuvaev on your way, give him a fiery firearm "hello" from me.
Okay, agreed. All right, going to Grig quickly now. Thank you!
Greetings, are you Grig?
Yes, that's me.
My name is Strelok. Leila told me that you might be able to help me with a matter.
Yes, she warned me. I'll help with what I can, Strelok. Speak.

The matter is like this, can't tell in two words... Basically, I'm looking for a brother. We "missed" each other here several years ago, in the Dead City, under very strange circumstances. Forester, and then Sakharov from Yantar said that they had met a man looking like me nicknamed "Captain" before. All they know is that he and several other desperate guys planned a raid to the Sarcophagus at the CNPP. Maybe you know something or, perhaps, heard about "Captain" and that team of stalkers?

Yes, Leila briefly told me about your case. No, I haven't met such a person personally. But I know a little more about that team of "suicides" who two and a half years ago attempted to get into the heart of the Zone, into the Sarcophagus. You know that the city of Pripyat is very close to the CNPP. That's exactly where they went through Pripyat. My partner was a guide for them, just like I was then, rest his soul, undertook to lead them to the hotel in Pripyat. No one went further in those days. He returned, and they went on. \n\nMy partner soon died from a high dose of radiation received in Pripyat... That's all I know. I don't know if you'll find your brother or the trail of that group of stalkers, but in any case, search should start in Pripyat, I tell you for sure. Only I strongly advise you not to meddle there. A rotten place: high radiation, everything swarming with anomalies. And on top of everything, half a year ago some group appeared there. Mysterious. Either half-humans or half-zombies. Basically, lately no one who dared to go to Pripyat has returned...
Well, wow... But I swore to myself to find my brother or find out what happened to him, so I have no other way. I must go to Pripyat. Can you escort me to the place? I'll pay or work it off somehow.

No, Strelok, I won't be able to act as a guide for you. Plenty of other important things to do. But to show the path leading from the Dead City to Pripyat - I will show. But, of course, not for free. Agreed?
Of course, agreed! What is required of me?
Well, basically, a mere trifle. Need to bring ten dog tails. There are plenty of dogs in the ravines on the outskirts of the Dead City.
Understood, I'll be quick.
Grig, I shot the dogs. Here are your ten tails.

That's great. The transition to Pripyat is through the sewer pipe of the Dead City. You'll find the entrance not far from here: First go strictly east until you pass the basketball court, and then turn northeast. Be careful there. And remember, this path is one-way only. You'll have to find the way back yourself. Well, good luck to you, Strelok. May your faith keep you! I'm here for a short while. Soon going to the Swamps. We have a checkpoint there. We'll meet again.
Thank you, Grig! See you around.
Greetings, Sergeant!
Strelok, we've been waiting for you. Time is short, we must act. Hands are itching, wanting to kick these bastards' asses as soon as possible! Is the Bar map with you?
Here is the map, Sergeant.

So, excellent. Now let's figure out how to distribute the strike forces... Aha, everything is clear. We enter the Bar and split into three groups. And then according to the situation. Well, time to move out. Are you with us?
Where would I go? Of course, with you. Let's go.

Then a special task for you: don't rush forward too much, but don't lag behind. First goes the assault group, then the snipers. I will go last. The most dangerous place is the narrow passage to the Bar territory from the northern checkpoint through the gates. Here, to avoid confusion, and not to become a good target for bandit shooters, someone needs to go slightly ahead and clear the passage of guards. I think you can handle this. Especially since you are like "one of their own" to the thugs. They won't immediately figure out what's what. \n\nWell, and then act according to the situation. But remember, we need to occupy several key positions. First, the "100 Rads" Bar itself, I'll direct the main strike forces there. Second, the bunker where the bandits have a prison. This will be my task exactly. Then we definitely must eliminate Knyaz, their leader. I'll entrust this to a couple of the most experienced guys. And, of course, both checkpoints need to be taken under control. One fighter will stand at the northern post immediately, and I'll send two to the southern one: an assaulter and a sniper. So, that's the layout. And then as luck has it. Is everything clear?
Yes, everything is clear to me. Moving out?
Well, Sergeant? Are you satisfied with how everything turned out?
Yes, quite. Now they can't kick us out of here! General Voronin and the others will arrive soon, and we'll set up a powerful Duty base here.
Well then, good luck to you.
How else can I be useful?

Need to meet General Voronin and escort him here. Several bandits led by Borov managed to escape the Bar territory from the southern side. And the General with three guards and another person with them are moving towards the Bar right now from the Garbage side to the southern post. Need to warn Voronin and escort him and those with him to me.
Understood. I'll run towards the Garbage. Hope I make it in time to warn the General about the possible danger.
Greetings, General!
Hello, Strelok! Well then, Plichko reported that the Bar territory is ours now. Very good news! And he sent you to help us get to the Bar, apparently?

Yes, exactly. Just that unfinished bandits could still remain in the district. By the way, Borov managed to escape from the Bar at the last moment... Couldn't catch him. And I see Barkeep is heading to the Bar with you too.

Okay, God be with him, with Borov, we'll catch him later. Main thing is the Bar is ours now. Here we are leading Barkeep with us. What is a Bar without a Barkeep? Especially since he organized everything. Well, let's go slowly to our new "residence".
Yes, moving out. Follow me, General.
Well then, here you are. How do you like it here?

A chic bunker! No worse than the scientists have at Yantar. Beauty! You, Strelok, deserved a really big reward. Here, take this, personally from me. Stop by Barkeep, he has a special gift for you. Now the rest of our brothers led by Colonel Petrenko from the Dark Valley can move here too.
Thank you, General. I'll go stop by Barkeep. See you again, hopefully.
Greetings, Doctor!
Hello, young man. You must be Strelok, about whom my student and assistant Paramedic informed me? Thank you for helping Ghost. We are in your debt.
No need for thanks, Doctor. I should rather thank you for meeting Paramedic in Pripyat. He cleared my brains and returned my memory.
Doctor, I have a very important question for you.
Listening, dear sir.

I want to ask you if you know a stalker nicknamed "Captain", who two and a half years ago, accompanied by several other brave stalkers, tried to penetrate through Pripyat into the CNPP territory and further into the Sarcophagus. He is my brother. I'm trying to find him or at least find out what happened to him. A man named "Grig" told me that his partner - a guide, accompanied that very group to the center of Pripyat. Then they went themselves, and he returned, but soon after died from a strong dose of radiation he received...

Yes, it was a long time ago... Indeed, several stalkers attempted to reach the CNPP and the Sarcophagus. But this, as I see, you already know without me. The leader in the group was indeed a certain "Captain". Whether he is your brother or not, I don't know, but comrades called him exactly "Captain".
Yes, Doctor, Ghost and Paramedic didn't lie. You really know a lot. Maybe you know some more significant details? What happened to them?

How this trip ended and what became of your brother, I won't say because I don't know. This story is covered in mystery and darkness. Now, after so much time, all this seems like mysticism or just a fairytale. But there is one detail that only I know and which makes this story quite real. I never told anyone about this, and in general, no one needed it. But for you, I see, details might be useful in your search.
And what is this detail? And generally, how do you know all this?

Grig, whom you mentioned, knows a lot. He is an "old seasoned wolf", been in many scrapes. But he still gave you not quite accurate information. More precisely, he simply didn't know about one nuance... That very guide comrade of his actually led the group not to the center of Pripyat, but transferred it directly to the CNPP territory. Took a risk and paid for it with his life...
So how do you know this?

That very guide, being already near death, came to me. I was no longer able to help him... He stayed with me for a week. God sees, I did everything possible, but, alas, it was all in vain... So, right before death, he told me himself that he took a risk and together with those stalkers crossed from Pripyat to the CNPP. And he did so because in Pripyat they found several unique artifacts that give very powerful protection against radiation and psi-impact. And everyone was confident that such protection would be sufficient and enough for everyone. 

But once on the CNPP territory, it turned out that the background was too high and there simply wouldn't be enough protective properties of artifacts for everyone. The group split. Only two went to the Sarcophagus, hung with all found artifacts - "Captain" and one more, Yuri Semetsky. The others returned to Pripyat and stayed there to wait for the return of those two. Only soon everyone felt a sharp malaise and were forced to return from where they came. They never waited for Captain and Semetsky. What happened next - no one knows for certain. Just then some devilry started: literally a couple of days later a powerful emission of psi-energy began, after which much in the Zone changed. 

After some time, the same message about Yuri Semetsky's death began coming to stalkers' PDAs, which comes to this day. Some of the "old-timers" claimed they saw Semetsky alive and healthy six months later, and then a year after all these events. Believe it or not, I don't know... Soon they stopped recalling it and the story of the stalkers' trip to the center of the Zone became just a legend, and the situation with constant messages about Semetsky's death was written off as another unexplained phenomenon of the Zone. Such is this difficult matter, Strelok. Try to find out from the masters, maybe someone did survive from that group? For this, you will have to go through the whole Zone, starting from here, from the Swamps, and to the Cordon itself.
Thank you, Doctor, you instilled hope in me! I believe I will find my brother's trail, or maybe him himself.
Doctor, how can I be useful to you?
There is a matter, just for such a brave and desperate person as you, Strelok.
Speak, I will gladly help you.

Here, in the Swamps, until a certain time everything was relatively calm. Well, except maybe a stray pack of dogs or stupid rodents appear. But these are trifles. And then suddenly quite recently some Swamp creature appeared. Scared all my "patients". Barely revived two fractures after their meeting with this monster. And yesterday night this hellspawn devoured all of my Murka's kittens. Actually, I can tame any beast, but this one... This one does not succumb to any influence and no hypnosis. That's how things are.
I understand, I need to find out who settled there in the Swamps, and destroy the mutant?

Yes, that's correct, Strelok. Just be careful. This is a very, very rare and dangerous creature. Wanderers, well, you know them, I gathered, since you already met Grig. They have a checkpoint still in the west of the Swamps, a small base... So they are afraid to even approach the place where presumably its lair is. They lost quite a few people when trying to destroy the creature. But I know you'll come up with something. You are smart. But I ask you again, be careful, Strelok. If you feel you can't overcome the monster, return back, we'll think of something else.
Don't worry, Doc, I've met all sorts of rubbish on my way while getting to you. So, whoever is there, can't scare me.
Yes, I've seen all sorts of things... But this! I've never met such a creature anywhere before.
Did you, young man, overcome this creature?
Yes, but had to work ve-e-ery hard!
Well, thank you, Strelok! You saved us all from great danger.
Come on, Doc, no need for thanks. Would be good not to meet this hellspawn again.
Doctor, I need to get out of here and move further in search of my brother. How do I leave the Swamps?

You see, young man, the transition to Pripyat is currently unavailable. After this last emission, everything turned upside down. And you, actually, don't need to go to Pripyat. You just came from there. From the Swamps, you can also get to the Forest, and from there further into the Zone. But this path can be known only to the Wanderers. You need to talk to Grig about this.

Okay, Doc, I'll go to the Wanderers' checkpoint, talk to Grig about the transition. I actually need to get to the Forest first. I left one elderly man there in bad condition. His name is Forester. Maybe you know him? I worry about him greatly, he helped me a lot.

I know Forester. Good man, sensible and brave. Not afraid to live alone in the Anomalous Forest, where it's full of deadly traps and various mutants. He is the one who will tell you how to pass from the Forest deeper into the Zone.
Understood. Means my path is through the Forest again. Thank you, Doc, and see you!
Hi, Grig! Haven't seen you in a while.
Hello, Strelok! So, found your brother?

No, Grig, haven't found the brother yet. Doctor told me some details that allow hoping for the best. But for this, I need to get deep into the Zone. Actually, I came to you to ask you to show the path further into the Zone through the Forest. Doctor says that you know where the path to the Forest is. Will you help?
Yes, Strelok, I can show you the transition to the Forest. And from the Forest, you'll come out to the Army Warehouses. Forester will help, you know him. But only a favor for a favor.
O-oh, excellent! Just on the way deep into the Zone I'll see Forester, how he is there... What is required of me?

As last time - a mere trifle. Need to check the work of one search device. Which one and why you don't need to know. All that is required of you is to escort our specialist, called Kent, to the abandoned village so he can test the device there. And then back him up on the way back. You never know, there is enough rubbish around here. We, of course, could handle it ourselves, but now no one from security can leave the checkpoint. We lost several people recently. Swamp creature tore them to shreds... And until Leila sends reinforcements from the Dead City, not one day will pass. So if you help us out, then I will help you. Show the path to the Forest.
Understood, I'll be quick. By the way, I eliminated this creature at Doctor's request, so nothing to fear particularly anymore.

You alone could destroy it??? Well, you, Strelok, are either an unheard-of brave man or crazy... Well okay, means even better, we won't find a better convoy than you. Means I wasn't mistaken. All right, time to move out. Kent is waiting for you at the end of the bridge by the wrecked truck. Follow him and watch out so nothing happens to him.
Okay, I'm going. Wait.
Hi, are you Kent?
Yes, that's me.
Grig asked to escort you to the measurement site. You have to test some device there, right?
Yes, yes, correct. I was just waiting for Grig to send someone. Only I thought there would be three people. Dangerous places there.
Don't chicken out, we'll handle it together. Just pay attention there, and I'll back you up if anything. Well, moving out.
See, and you were afraid. Together with you overcame the creatures without much trouble! So, what? Are we there?
Yes, that's it. We are there. Now I'll quickly check the settings, wait a bit. And then we'll go back immediately.
Okay, be faster, waiting.
Well, measurement operation completed?

Yes, everything is excellent. I still need to tinker with the device settings here a little, and everything will be ready. And huge thanks to you for help. All right, go to Grig. Report to him that his task is completed, the device functions normally. In a couple-three hours I will finish settings and return to the Checkpoint.
Well okay, bye. Take care.
Task completed, Grig. Your man returned alive and unharmed.

Well, that's great! Here, look, I'll mark the transition from Swamps to Forest in your PDA. True, this is a one-way transition... If you need to return to Swamps again, find Pathfinder in the Bar, he'll help find the "Secret Path" to us here. Understood everything?
Yes, everything is clear. I'm going.
Glad to see you, father. How is health?

Strelok? Thought I wouldn't see you, son, anymore... It's hard for me alone here, without a helper. I went to the forest recently for roots for scientists, and forest cats attacked me. A whole pack! Fought them off with grief in half. Only they bruised my sides, ugly creatures. And with medicines, as luck would have it, trouble. The courier from eggheads still hasn't arrived.
Bruised sides, you say? Let me help you with medicine. Here, take this, heal up.
Thank you, son. And take something from me in gratitude. Here, a rare recipe for artifact transmutation, you'll find it useful.
Won't refuse, thank you.
How have you been here all this time?
I'm fine now, but where have you been? Found anything about the brother?
Oh, father, so much happened to me during this time, can't tell everything.
Well, tell the old man briefly about your affairs.

Well, if briefly, I ended up in Pripyat. Got memory loss there - managed to get into an anomaly. Then salvation. One "sorcerer" saved me, called Mervin. For some time I was a brainless soldier-puppet in the "Monolith" clan at the CNPP. Then people of the Swamp Doctor "pulled me out" and helped get out of Pripyat to the Swamps. Then met the Swamp Doctor. Learned something about my brother. Now came to the Forest again. And next I need to get deep into the Zone.
Yes, son, that's how life "spun" you. Well okay, alive and good. What do you plan to do next?
Well, I'm saying, next I need to get deep into the Zone. They told me that you can show the path leading to the Army Warehouses.

Well, I don't know this path myself, never went there. But there are some guys - hunters. They appear here in the Forest sometimes for a short while to hunt mutants. They collect certain parts of these mutants and then sell to scientists. So hunters are here right now. Just visited me yesterday. Chatted with them about this and that, drank tea. Basically, they have a temporary camp not far here, to the southeast. The leader among them is a seasoned hunter nicknamed "Hunchback". Find him and talk. He definitely knows how to get to the Army Warehouses. And I'll mark the coordinates how to find hunters on the map.
Aha, understood. Give the coordinates and I'll go find these hunters.
Hi, are you Hunchback?
Well, I am. And who are you? and what brought you here?

My name is Strelok. Forester told me that you can show me the transition from the Forest to the Army Warehouses. And generally I wander the Zone looking for a brother, called "Captain". Have you heard anything about such a stalker and his team, which a couple of years ago made a bold attempt to sneak into the very heart of the Zone, into the Sarcophagus?

Ah, so that's it... Okay, then it's another matter. About "Captain" I heard nothing. And we don't particularly communicate with anyone. We are hermits by ourselves. But the path from the Forest to the Army Warehouses can be shown. But, you understand yourself, favor for favor. I'm equipping a couple of fighters to shoot boars here, to collect hooves for sale. Here is a proposal for you: help them shoot mutants, and we will open the Secret Path to the Warehouses for you. Agree?
Well, what else can I do? Agree. Say when and with whom moving out.

Now that's business! So: the leader for the "operation" is Grek. There he is, bored on the side. Zakhar will go with him. Old stump, but knows his business. True, he whines constantly. You chat with him later, he needs something in the "inhabited" Zone, and you are seemingly going there. Maybe you'll help with something. And if suddenly you collect necessary mutant parts, then contact Mazay or Zakhar, they will exchange various "tails-hooves" for ammo and medkits. Well okay, that's just in case. And now to business: go to Grek now, he will give all instructions on the upcoming operation. Help him, he will show the transition to Warehouses to you later after we do the job. Clear?
Yes, everything is clear. Going to Grek.
Hi, Grek.
Hello, stalker. So, ready for the big hunt?
I'm always ready for anything. Speak, what's the plan.

Everything is outrageously simple: Now moving out three of us to the place. You, me and Zakhar. Don't get ahead of me, need to sneak up quietly there. It's not far, near the fallen tree. We tracked a pack of boars there recently. So we'll hunt them. Just be careful, these are treacherous creatures. As we do the job, Zakhar will take you to the transition to Warehouses. And I'll give you three packs of armor-piercing ammo for Kalash and a couple of packs of "darts" for shotgun. And throw in a couple of scientific medkits, won't be superfluous. So, ready to move out?
I'm always ready, like a pioneer. Give the ammo and let's go.
Well, Grek, shot the mutants after all!
Yes, worked nicely. Well then, now, as promised, Zakhar will take you to the place where the path leading to Army Warehouses starts. Follow him, don't get ahead, but don't lag behind.
Thanks and good luck.
Well, Zakhar, are we there?
Yes, we are on the spot. The path leading to Army Warehouses starts here, between boulders.
Understood everything, thank you. Maybe there is some request for me?

Well, basically, there is one request. I heard out of the corner of my ear here, when you were talking with Hunchback, that you are looking for a missing brother. Eh... in your question I can't help with anything, sorry... But I have a very similar situation to yours. Maybe you'll understand my position... There is one man, his surname is Sobolev. Retired military. We used to be neighbors with him before, before the disaster. Lived nearby for twenty-something years. Went fishing, hunting together, families were friends. During the disaster our families died... \n\nSince then I have no one closer than him left. Sobolev and I then decided to stay here, in the Zone, where our families are buried. Started moonlighting as guides. At first for tourists, then for stalkers. Knew these places well. And then our paths parted. We quarreled with him once, quarreled badly, and I decided to leave and joined Hunters. And he remained a guide. And where is he now?.. Eh, haven't heard about him for a long time. Know that in the Zone, but where fate carries him?
So there is a stalker network, can search through it. Do you have a PDA?
No, Strelok, don't have. And I don't know how to use it. Basically, I have a request for you: if you meet Sobolev, give him this personal letter. Want to make up with him.
Okay, Zakhar. If I find Sobolev, I will definitely give him your letter. And now it's time for me. Show where the path to Warehouses starts and I'm moving out.
General. I ended up here, in the Dark Valley, not just like that.
And what brought you here?
My name is Strelok. I'm looking for my brother. I have information that he is in your ranks. Works as a guide for you. His nickname is "Captain". Is he here with you?
So that's it. Yes, in our ranks there is Captain, an experienced guide. Walked the Zone far and wide. Only he never said he had a brother. Strange...
There is! He has a brother! It's me. Just we lost each other long, very long ago. So where, General, can I find "Captain"? My older brother, huh?
Don't make noise like that. He is here, here, I say. Go to the yard, there is a small structure, you'll find him there. Then return to me. I have some work for you, daredevil.
Good! Would you look at that... I found him after all! All right, running, I'll be quick.
Uh-uh... "Captain"?!
Yes, Captain Sobolev, at your service. How can I help, young man?
Damn it! How can this be, huh?
And what, actually, is the matter? What is happening here?
I stomped half the Zone looking for my brother. Suffered so much during this time. And in the end get such a result of all my sufferings and insane risk... Lord, why are you so unfair to me!
Stop hysterics, soldier! What do I have to do with it?

With the fact that my brother's name is Captain. And I came here, to the Dark Valley, to finally find him. I received information that a stalker nicknamed Captain is in Duty location in the Dark Valley. But fate is ironic! I met "Captain", only not the right one...
Ye-e-ah, fate sometimes plays cruel jokes on us. Regret that I became the indirect cause of your disappointments, stalker.
Okay, captain. You have absolutely nothing to do with it here. Excuse me for a moment of weakness.
And what do I do now with searching for the brother? Have no idea.
Don't hang your nose, Strelok! I will try to help you. Especially since I remembered something...
What? You know something about my brother?

Yes, I know something. As you probably know from Zakhar, we were guides once and led various tourists and stalkers around the Zone. And about that very expedition to the Sarcophagus, in which your brother "Captain" participated, I know not by hearsay.
Yes, Zakhar told me about this.

So, I didn't participate in that raid myself, but I know a lot about this sortie from a buddy. He was exactly the guide for those stalkers. Died, true, later. He told that only two went into the Sarcophagus itself: "Captain" and Yuri Semetsky. None of them returned, but no one found their corpses either. But everyone was sure they died. Some time later I led one experienced digger through the "Red Forest" to Pripyat. And so he told that he saw alive and unharmed Yuri Semetsky and even allegedly talked to him. Where he saw Semetsky, he didn't tell. \n\nI didn't believe him then. After all, legends were already composed about Semetsky by that time - "Eternal Stalker". You probably know yourself about these constant messages on PDA, about endless deaths of this Semetsky. Besides this, he said he was a participant of that very expedition and that only one of all remained alive. Well, except Semetsky, if believe his words. Would be good for you to find that man and find out from him where he saw Semetsky and what he talked about with him. If all this is true, and Semetsky is alive, and that digger really was part of that very group, then, maybe, your brother is also alive, and you can find him...
And what was that digger's name and where can he be found?

Well, where to find him, neither I nor anyone of ours knows. And his nickname is "Mahomet". Where to find Mahomet, someone of traders might know. "Barkeep" from Cordon or "Sidorovich", who settled in the village on the territory of Glubokoe station.
You instilled new hope in me, captain. Thank you! And is it possible to go to Cordon by a short road from Dark Valley, otherwise have to stomp through Garbage for a long time?
Possible. About the transition from Dark Valley to Cordon you need to talk to Voronin.
I'll go ask Voronin about the transition to Cordon. And he had some business for me anyway.
Hi! Who are you?

We are vagabonds, like everyone. I'm called Tankist. Marauders battered us with guys recently, barely escaped alive. Now sitting here, licking wounds. And who are you yourself and what are you doing here?

I am Strelok. Looking for a trace of missing brother. By the way, being in the Dead City I found a corpse, rather even already a skeleton of some stalker and a diary next to him. So, in this diary, besides everything else, there was a mention of a certain device. Called Bioradar. And also it said there that a stalker nicknamed Tankist might know where a specimen of this device can be obtained.
So that's it. Was that deceased called Krol by any chance?
Yes, exactly, Krol. At least, the diary was signed with this name.

I knew this Krol. Was a meticulous man, attentive. See, kept a diary too, turns out. Pity he died. As for Bioradar: yes, indeed, several prototypes were stolen from eggheads and went somewhere "away" later. By the way, I have nothing to do with this case, if you thought something. I just knew a kid who participated in this robbery. He sold me one device later: A good thing, I tell you!
So is this device with you now?
No, I lost it. Dropped it when running from marauders.
Why don't you go find it? What if someone finds it? Will be a shame to lose such a thing.

Too dangerous place there. I'm afraid. My life is dearer to me. Can offer you a deal: you find and bring me my unique gun anomalous "Groza", which I also lost. And I'll give you a tip where I dropped Bioradar. You, man, I see, are not timid. Maybe you'll find the device. It will surely be useful to you in your brother searches. And I, honestly say, plan to bail from the Zone. Does such offer suit you?

What a scatterbrain you are... Dropped Bioradar, lost your anomalous "Groza"... And where is your tank? Lost too?.. Come on! Don't get angry, I'm joking.. Your offer suits me. Where to search for your gun?

The matter was like this: we with guys were running from marauders through "Wild Territory". Well, "Rostok" factory. You probably know. Scary place. Normal people try not to appear there, bypass it. So that's where I dropped it. The place where it happened is not hard to find: if walking from "Bar" side, go towards transition to Yantar. Reach unfinished building. Then go further and see a green wagon, which sort of fences off a small area. So in the yard, behind this wagon I waited out for a short while. Must search there. That's all. Yes, and give me that diary you found in Dead City. You don't need it anyway.
Understood, wait. Will try to find your "Groza".
Hi, Tankist! Found your "Groza". Good thing, I tell you.
O-oh, thank you! I thought that's it. Goodbye, my gun, forever. Give me my beauty here quickly.
Well, you are a brisk fellow. Forgot what you promised in return? Come on, to make everything fair, lay out the tip on "Bioradar" and then take your gun.

So, listen here: we ran from marauders through "Wild Territory". Well, "Rostok" factory. You probably know. Scary place. Normal people try not to appear there, bypass it. So that's where I dropped it. The place where it happened is not hard to find: if walking from "Bar" side, go towards transition to Yantar. Reach unfinished building. Then go further and see a green wagon, which sort of fences off a small area. So in the yard, behind this wagon I waited out for a short while. Must search there. That's all. Yes, and give me that diary you found in Dead City. You don't need it anyway.
Understood. Okay, trust your word. Take your "Groza" and Krol's diary, and it's time for me.
Greetings!
Who are you? This is a closed territory. To pass, need an electronic special pass of the military. Have a special pass?
I work as a guide for the military at Cordon. Here is my pass.
Hello, "ghostly" trader.
Why so pompous? Speak up, who are you and why did you come. Haven't seen you before.

I am Strelok. And I haven't been here before. I'm walking too long, and my path is oh so not simple. So now I am here. Brought you a message from Barkeep, because the connection is glitching after the last emission, and he can't contact you at all. And the matter, he says, is secret. Here, take the encrypted letter from Barkeep.
Listen, Sidorovich. I have a personal matter for you.
Wait a minute. Now I'll read what this "Cunning Fox" writes to me. So-so... Interesting layout. Uh-huh... Look how he laid everything out "on the shelves"! .. Okay, what's that matter of yours?

I'm looking for my brother. Called "Captain". We "got lost" with him more than two years ago under very strange circumstances. Well okay, that's long to tell. I already walked almost the entire Zone, talked to many "old-timers" on this topic, but so far all in vain. But hope still exists.

So how can I help? I don't go into the Zone. I learn the latest news and gossip from stalkers and diggers who drop by here from time to time, or via stalker radio channel, which doesn't work here at all now.
Barkeep told me that you know a digger nicknamed Mahomet. He seems to drop by you often. I need to find him and find out something that can help find the brother.
Yes, I know Mahomet. He was just here the day before yesterday. Turned in loot and went back to the Zone.
Listen, I don't understand. This is supposedly Peacekeepers territory. So how do stalkers scurry back and forth? Turns out to be some thoroughfare, not a "closed territory".

Well, you are a smart fellow, walked the whole Zone, you say. So you should know that there is always a "Secret Path" through which one can pass unnoticed. Understand? Do you think they go through the checkpoint? No, of course, other paths lead into and out of the Zone. And Peacekeepers are good guys, true a bit dim-witted. Think everything is under control for them, but actually everything is a bit different. The territory here is large, and they don't control nearly all key points and not all routes are known to them. And they don't particularly want to climb and sort it out. \n\nAs long as everything is calm and peaceful, they remain confident in safety and complete order. They often drop by me for booze. We, so to speak, are "friends". This is not the Zone, after all, and who comes to my store doesn't concern them. Maybe guys from nearby villages stopped by, what's the big deal. Check documents and that's it. True, after the last emission everything changed here. Looks like the Zone started absorbing this previously free territory too. Look, anomalies started appearing here and there. And guys said they seemed to see mutants in the Forest. Such affairs. Peacekeepers will surely activate now.
Now understood. So still, where can I find Mahomet?

How would I know where his legs will carry him this time. He is a digger! Where he smells scent, there he goes. You, if you want, can wait for him here, in the village. In ten days he should come, or maybe earlier.
I don't have that much time. And can't contact him somehow? Ah yes, I forgot, trouble with connection here. What to do? I desperately need to talk to him.

Okay, will try to help you. One person should come to me soon. They have a meeting with Mahomet scheduled somewhere in the Zone. Will try to find out from him where they planned to meet with Mahomet. Only favor for favor, while we are waiting anyway. You do something for me.
O-oh, now that's a business conversation! What needs to be done?

Well, firstly, need to carry the answer to Barkeep. But that's later. First I must think about his proposal. And now you'll need to go to Peacekeepers base and carry five bottles of whiskey to General Smith. He asked to get some. And now, due to all these changes, need to be friends with Peacekeepers, otherwise they'll close my shop here in two counts. In short, carry five bottles to the General, say you are a messenger from me. I'll warn the General about you by radio. Fortunately, connection works at least within this territory. Talk to him, maybe help them with something else. Say you are local, live not far here, know these places well. If asked why with a weapon, say you work as a guide for military, understood? Well, Barkeep probably prepared you without me what to say. When you finish everything there, return to me.
Yes, understood everything. Give the bottles and I'll go.
Greetings, General!
Ah, courier from Sidorovich. Well, come on, what do you have there?
Here. Sidorovich passed something to you. Take it.
How can I be useful, General?
Well, I see you are not a simple guy. Look how armed. Not a saboteur by chance?
Come on, I'm local. Moonlighting as a guide for military at Cordon. Now helping Sidorovich. My name is Strelok.

Okay, Strelok. We trust Sidorovich. Local, you say? Means you should know these places well. We had an emergency here. A soldier disappeared, Corporal Foster. Was sent with a secret report to the Checkpoint. Delivered the report, but didn't return. Something is wrong here. Before everything was calm, but now, after this last emission, everything turned upside down. Looks like the Zone captured this section too. Anomalous activity is observed everywhere and mutated animals were seen repeatedly. Problems with connection too...
Yeah. All this I already noticed myself, not stupid. So what is required of me?

You see, my people - they are soldiers. Just soldiers... They aren't supposed to think and make decisions. You are different... you are on your own. You survive, not live. You think and weigh every step, every action. In the end, you always make decisions yourself. Am I right? Ri-i-ight! I see through people like you. Loners... Keep to themselves... Well anyway, now your experience is exactly what we need.
General, enough philosophy. Let's get to business.
Okay, agreed. Now is not the time for philosophy. Corporal Foster didn't return from the task. Need to find him. Get all details from Colonel Brown. Go to him. If you help us, we'll pay well.
Okay. Will help with what I can.
Greetings, Colonel Brown. General sent me to you. About the case of missing corporal.

Ah. Yes, yes, we are just looking for a person who can help us. The essence of the problem is: the corporal took documents to the Checkpoint and was supposed to return, but didn't return. It's been two days he's missing. We tracked his PDA signal. Signal is weak, but stable. Impossible to contact. Constant interference. Combed the whole square - unsuccessfully. He vanished into thin air. Basically, my people are simple soldiers. Need an experienced digger. I understand you work as a guide for military, right?
Yes, correct. My name is Strelok. Give me the coordinates of the place where signal comes from, and I'll try to find the corporal or find out what happened to him there.
Give me your PDA, Strelok. I'll mark the search radius. Definitely find him. And if alive, bring Corporal Foster here, to the base. We won't remain in debt.
Understood. Mark the place, and I'm moving out for the search.
I found Corporal Foster, Colonel. Alive, healthy, delivered to base. Will tell everything himself later, what happened to him.

Well done! My fighters spent a whole day, but never found the corporal. And look how fast you managed. Expressing gratitude to you from all our leadership. And here is deserved monetary reward from us.
Glad to serve! Thank you.
Wait. Too early to thank. There are more matters.
Well, hello, Corporal.
Thank you! You are my savior! And I already thought that's it, I'm done for. These creatures will devour me for lunch. What is my savior's name?
Call me Strelok. How did you manage to end up here anyway, in such "friendly" company?

Oh, Strelok, don't ask... Don't understand myself. Seemed to walk the usual road, as always. Then something buzzed in the head, and some feeling appeared that someone is controlling me. And mainly, I don't want to resist... Well, can't explain better. And then suddenly boom and enlightenment. And you standing in front of me. How long was I here?

About two days, I assume. And what happened to you - is a Controller. He captured your mind and brought here, but, apparently, was full, so left you "for later". Well okay, time to get out of here, they are waiting for you at the base. Let's go, I'll escort you.
So what, Colonel, is there more work?
There is. Just for such an experienced digger as you.
Well, you clearly exaggerate my abilities, Colonel. What is the matter?

As you probably already know, here used to be absolutely ordinary territory - waiting room of the Zone. So to speak, a checkpoint. And after the last emission everything turned upside down. Looks like the Zone captured this section too. Anomalous activity is observed everywhere and mutated animals were seen repeatedly. Problems with connection too arose...
Yeah. All this I already noticed myself, not stupid. So what is required of me?

The place where we are now is a forced coincidence. Actually, our main base is in another place. Not far here, in the south, is our main base. Only we had to leave it hurriedly, because after the last emission absolutely incomprehensible things started happening there. Everyone seemed to go crazy. Soldiers and officers started shooting each other, who remained alive, later shot himself. And after even worse. We had a scientist, so he went and disabled the radar. Without radar we are like without hands. Were cut off from the whole world. No connection, provisions running out, can't call for help. From "Big Land" they don't hurry here either, afraid. This is now Zone territory, turns out. And finally some mutants attacked the base. Had to retreat hurriedly from there. We blocked the gates when leaving. Imagine what is happening there now.
Yes, "fun" you have here, Colonel. And what do you want to do?

Must win back the base by all means. Then will be necessary to fix the radar and establish connection. And you have the power to help us. You seem to be a specialist in all Zone wisdoms and all sorts of devilry. And there exactly anomalous things will be encountered. I and five more fighters will go with you. No more people. Can't abandon this temporary base either. Dangerous without normal security. So, agree? I won't remain in debt. Reward will be appropriate.
Okay, persuaded. When moving out?

Leaving now. Cannot delay. Just don't rush, walk nearby. Five fighters will already wait for us there. We'll reach the base gates with you, meet my fighters, orient by situation and make a decision what to do next. Here, take an assault rifle, five packs of armor-piercing ammo, three F-1 grenades and several medkits and bandages.
Clear. Give weapons, ammo and let's go.
Here. Take and moving out.
So? Everyone seems to be in place.
Yes, everything in order. May Virgin Mary keep us all!
Understood everything, Colonel. I'm going.
Go on, be careful there.
So what, Colonel? Job done. Base under your control again.

Yes, was a glorious hunt. Now need to bring everything in order here, and most importantly - fix the radar and restore connection. Thank you, Strelok, you helped us out. But that's not all. Here, take deserved reward for now. This is a universal repair kit with bio-electronic damage level scanning. Intended for repair of any type of small arms. Restores one hundred percent of damage. Created in secret military laboratory of Peacekeepers. Operation principle built on anomalous properties of "Jellyfish" artifact. To activate repair kit, presence of "Jellyfish" artifact in inventory is necessary. After each repair procedure "Jellyfish" artifact evaporates, transferring all its anomalous properties to activate bio-electronic scanner. Very rare thing. Use it.
O-oh, dreamed of such for a long time! Thank you!
Colonel, you said that's not all. What did you mean?

We returned the base to ourselves. That's good. But there is also an abandoned antenna. Not far here, northwest of the base. So. We had temporary connection there. Had... Until some treacherous creature appeared there. And had to leave the antenna following the base. Before you appeared, General Smith sent a small special forces squad there for reconnaissance, but they didn't return. Not even a weak signal from their PDA. How crappy without connection... We will urgently deal with radar restoration now.
You suggest organizing a raid there too?

No, not enough forces for assault now. Just need to quietly scout everything there and find out what happened to our fighters. You'll handle it, I know. I saw how you can do it. So, will you help once more?
Okay, will help. What exactly needs to be done?

Sneak there and look what is happening there now and what happened to our people. Find any traces of the missing squad. Then return to General Smith and report the situation to him. Take a couple of military medkits just in case and a couple of F-1 grenades.
Understood. Going for reconnaissance.
Greetings, General!
And to you too, Strelok.
Colonel Brown asked me to scout the territory of the old antenna, where you had temporary connection earlier and where your recon squad disappeared recently.
So what? Were you there? What did you manage to find out?
I was there. Territory around antenna is swarming with zombies. Found the corpse of only one. He had a PDA, on which were his last words before death.
Oh you damn... How many people we lost in the last week. Well okay, we'll tune the radar, call helicopters and take all scum to hell out of here!
Okay, General. Helped with what I could. If not needed anymore for now, I'll go to Sidorovich. One important matter awaits me there.

Thank you, Strelok. Helped us out greatly. From here we are on our own. Just that I have nothing particular to reward you with. We are in poverty ourselves: ammo, provisions and medicines running out. Well, except maybe I can guarantee you free passage to our territory at any time. Ah yes, here I have an assault rifle. But tight with ammo. Sorry.
Thank you! Will drop by you sometime later. And now time for me. See you and good luck! Here, take the PDA I found.
Sidorovich, here I am.
Returned? Well done! Did you take the whiskey to General Smith?

Yes, delivered the whiskey. Then had to run and shoot a bit, at the Peacekeepers' request. Had to save someone there. Saved him. Also cleared their old base from mutants. Now they will try to fix the radar and restore connection. So things are getting better for them. And now I'm sort of "friends" with them.
I see. Means we can calm down for a while. While you were away, I wrote an answer for Barkeep here. Here, I ask you to pass the encrypted message to him on your way back.
Okay. Give me the letter, I'll pass it.
And what about my question?

So, listen here: that Stalker who has a meeting set with Mahomet came to see me. Basically, their meeting is scheduled somewhere in the Dead City, on the outskirts. You'll find him there. Don't delay too much. How to get to the Dead City, I think you'll figure out.

How will I figure out how to get to the Dead City? I have only one lead - it's the Wanderers on the Swamps. Grig is in charge there, he surely knows. Or the Swamp Doctor. But first I need to get to the Swamps. And how?
You are reasoning correctly. You need to go to Yantar to the scientists. They possibly know safe paths to the Swamps and, maybe, even to the Dead City.
Understood everything. Thank you very much! Means my path is to Yantar now.
Yes. But don't forget to pass the letter to Barkeep at the Cordon, since you undertook to help.
Don't worry, I'll do it. See you!
Good day! Are you called Mahomet?
Na-ah, I'm Fima. And who are you? And why are you looking for Mahomet?
My name is Strelok. I have personal business with Mahomet. Sid told me that I could find Mahomet here. He was supposed to have a meeting here. Apparently with you, as I understand.
Ah, so that's it... Well yes, Mahomet was here. We really met here. So you are a bit late. Mahomet left. Where to - I don't know.
Da-amn! How can that be... I'm late. Unbelievable. And I need this Mahomet so much. Do you surely not know where he can be found now? I'll pay well for information.
