I don't need your money. I really don't know where he headed now. Mahomet never spreads word about where he goes next. He is a loner. But Sid told me about you, that a stalker nicknamed "Strelok" craves a meeting with Mahomet. So it means it's you?
Yes, it's me. But what should I do now? I have no idea...

Don't worry so much. I told Mahomet about you, that Strelok wanted to meet him very much. Very much. Mahomet couldn't wait, so he left. He will find you himself. As they say: "If the mountain won't come to Mahomet - Mahomet goes to the mountain". So don't worry.
How will he find me? Should I sit in one place and wait?
I'm telling you - he will find you! You just don't know Mahomet. If he said he'll find, means he'll find. Moreover, he said he heard about your exploits and wouldn't mind meeting you himself.
Okay, I understood. I will hope that he really finds me. Thank you. Whatever happens. See you.
Greetings, Chieftess!
Haven't seen you in a while, Strelok. What successes? Found the brother?
No, haven't found the brother yet, but I definitely will. I'm here on another matter now.
And what matter brought you to us?

Don't even know how to start... Basically, I turned out to be slightly aware of your relationships with Clear Sky members. Including about your sister Karina I learned... Anyway, closer to business: Sviblov sent me here. Karina left to you a few days ago and disappeared.
What are you saying!? She was here. Came with a guide. They left three days ago. So she didn't return to Radar?
No, didn't return. Sviblov sent people to search, but they disappeared too.
Sviblov... idiot! Never liked him... Yes, our relationship with Clear Sky is not entirely smooth, but he could have at least informed about my sister. What a bastard! I'm so angry...
Okay, don't boil over. Which road did she take back?

She said she knows the road well. They went through the Forest with her guide, since there is no return path from here to Radar, so only through the Forest. She said it's no more than half a kilometer there to the exit to Radar, and along the edge of the Forest at that. Supposedly safe places. What happened there? Need to send someone to search. And my people have never been to the Forest, this territory is unfamiliar to us...

Let's do this: since I volunteered to help find your sister, then I should go to the Forest. That territory is familiar to me, plus Forester lives there, will help if anything. And there are hunters too. They surely know something. By the way, is the path to the Forest in the same place?

Yes, the passage to the Forest is still where it was before. Here, just in case, I'll send the mark of the transition start to your PDA. Just I beg you very much, as soon as something clears up about my sister, inform me immediately by any means. Agreed?
Yes, of course. Well, I'm going to the Forest.
Hello, Father! Long time no see.
Glad to see you, Strelok. How is your search?

Still nothing so far. But there is hope. I need to find one experienced digger nicknamed Mahomet. He can shed light on this whole tangled and mystical story with my brother. By the way, do you know this digger? Where can he be found?
No, son, I don't know such a man. And what brought you to the Forest to the old man again?

Well, firstly, to visit you, and secondly, a matter turned up. A girl disappeared, Leila's sister. They say she went from the Dead City to Radar through the Forest. Three days already, as she disappeared: no news, no trace. Maybe got lost. Do you know anything about this?
No, haven't seen any girl here. Better ask the hunters. They are still hunting here. Stayed a bit late this time. Apparently want to collect more tails and hooves, or maybe something else.
Okay, thank you. I'll go to the hunters, find out what's what. Maybe they'll help find Leila's sister.
Greetings to fearless hunters!
What, Strelok? Decided to hunt with us or on another matter?
I hunted enough while wandering the Zone searching for my brother. I came to you on business.
Well, speak out, what business brought you to us.
You see, a girl disappeared here. Went from Dead City to Radar through the forest with a guide, but never reached Radar. Three days passed already. Maybe you know something? Saw them here?

Well, listen, you came to the right address. Just yesterday evening Grek and Mazay went to the bridge and, when returning, said they saw three people from afar. Seems like two old women and a young girl with them. Were dragging along the road towards the tunnel. Well, Grek and Mazay decided it was someone from the locals who live in the village closest to the Forest, you never know why they walk here. My guys didn't approach and scare them, we don't need it, we try not to interfere in anything. Although, they say, they were a bit strange, the girl looked sick.
Wow! And where did your eagles see these three?
Right here in the forest, let me mark the place on the map for you. There is an old bridge, a tunnel next to it.
Thank you. I'll go, maybe I'll catch up with them yet.
Go on, dare, Strelok.
Hello, grandmother.
Hello, dear man. What brought you here?
I'm looking for a girl. Called Karina. Hunters told me they allegedly saw two old women and a young girl with them recently. I understand, that's you.

Oh, you pra-a-ankster! Want a girl? Well, then you came to the right place. We have a girl. Young, beautiful. And inexpensive. Only three thousand rubles. Give the money and amuse yourself, relax. Our girl is very good, you won't regret it.
What are you saying! I didn't come for this. I have a task to find a girl named Karina. I must talk to her. Let me in. I need to see Karina.

O-oh, dear, don't confuse us. Find, see, talk, then want to touch, and then something else... Sli-i-y one! Anyway: pay first, and only then enter and do what you want with her. Our granddaughter is affectionate and responsive. And if you think of misbehaving, my sister will blow your head off with the gun in a flash! So, will you pay?
I don't have money now. I'll go try to get some from the hunters.
Okay, to hell with you, old perverts. Here is three thousand rubles, take it.
Well, hold on, boy!
Well, hello, Karina.
O-oh, how my head is splitting... What is wrong with me?
Nothing scary, will pass soon. Need to drink vodka, helps.
And who are you? Where am I?
Don't worry, I'm a friend. Controllers captured you, decided to use as bait. But now everything is fine. They are no more. My name is Strelok. I came for you, Sviblov sent me.
Lord, everything is like in a fog... Everything is floating... Sviblov? And where am I now?
We are in the Forest. You were walking from your sister Leila from Dead City to Radar. Walked with a guide. Remember at least this?
Yes, remembering now... Guide... Those... those creatures killed him! There, on the hill. Only he knew the way.
So. Do I understand correctly that you don't know how to get out of the Forest to Radar?
Do I look like a stalker or digger? Of course I don't know!
I see. Thought so. But we must get you out of here somehow. Any thoughts? I know there is a path to Army Warehouses here. Maybe there?

No, no, can't go there. Enemies there. Need to find the guide's body. He should have a PDA in his pocket with encrypted data about secret paths. I know the code. Find the PDA, means we can get out somewhere from the Forest. Must search. Let's go, I'll show approximately the place where those creatures killed him. I remember. We'll reach the place, and there I'll remember where to search.
Okay, let's go.
Well, are we there?

Yes, I remember exactly. The guide died here. While I was still conscious, I saw them dragging him here. We absolutely must find the guide's corpse and take his PDA. Otherwise we won't get out of here. I'm scared...
Okay, I'll try to find. Wait here, don't be afraid. If anything, scream, I'll come to rescue.
I found your guide's corpse.
Did you take the PDA?
Yes. Here, take it.
So... Let's see what paths are in the Forest.
Well, what's there?

Don't rush me! Now, wait... Aha, here: From the Forest one can go only to Swamps now. No way to Radar... Well okay then. Everyone annoyed me. Both Sviblov and my sister. Everyone is annoying, bickering among themselves like dogs... I'll go to Doctor. He is a kind man. Especially since I helped him in his clinic once. So it's decided, going to the Swamps to Doctor!
Well, to the Swamps, then to the Swamps. Lead, beauty.

It's okay, everything is fine, don't be afraid. What a beast! Main thing, sneaked up so unnoticed... Apparently followed us the whole way. Well anyway. What do we have here? Transition to Swamps here?

Whew! Almost peed myself from fear... Yes, transition is here. To the left of me is a hole. Need to go down there, transition will be there. Only can't predict to which place of the Swamps it will throw. Every time and with everyone it's different. So let's agree: you go first. If in a minute I'm not near, means we meet in Swamp Doctor's house. Yes, by the way, I never thanked you for my rescue. Sorry... Thank you, Strelok! You saved my ass.
Don't mention it. Saving your ass was a pleasure! By the way, I paid three thousand to controllers for you...
Oh-oh, how cool we are! Just no need to be rude. Okay, that's it, time to go.
Yes, we stayed too long here. Time.
Beauty, you ended up on the spot faster than me.
Yes, "threw" me right near the gazebo in front of Doctor's house. And what took you so long?
And I ended up in the southern part of Swamps, so had to get here practically swimming. My feet are all wet. Should dry them, although time is short and plenty of things to do.
Yes, things will wait. Rest. This is probably the calmest place in the whole Zone. I, perhaps, will stay here with Doctor. Will help him.
How so? And Sviblov? And Leila? They worry about you. Need to inform them that you are alive and healthy.
Don't worry. Doctor will inform via Grig, and I'll contact Sviblov myself later.
Well okay, as you wish... Listen, how do I leave the Swamps now?
O-oh, that you need to go to Doctor. Ask him.
Okay. Going to talk to Doc.
Doc, good day.
Glad to see you, Strelok. Thank you for saving Karina. She already told me briefly about your adventures.
Trifles. Been in worse scrapes.
No, Strelok. I haven't met such a brave stalker as you for a long time. You have a brave heart, kind soul and pure thoughts. Such a set is rarely met in the Zone.
Well, thank you, of course, for the compliment, Doc. Only I have a question for you: how to get out of Swamps. Well, somewhere closer to the Bar?

I will help you. I have a guide dog named Barbos. He will show you one of the most secret and long paths of the Zone - transition from Swamps through Dead City to Army Warehouses. This path was discovered by my faithful friend and guide Pathfinder. But first I will ask you to do one thing.
Listening to you attentively, Doctor.

I have a transmitter and antenna installed in the southern part of Swamps, in one of the old wooden houses. It is the best, and, basically, the only place in this part of Swamps for signal reception. So, recently the antenna broke three times already. Never happened before... I went first time - fixed it. Went second time - fixed it. Well, thought, wind or birds breaking it. Moved the transmitter to a slightly different place and again the same thing. I went there the third time. Arrived at the spot, look - no transmitter. \n\nWalked around and found it in a completely different place. And such a feeling arose that someone is watching me, looking at my back. Turned around - no one. Listened and hear some barely distinguishable sounds. As if a child is sobbing quietly. Definitely not a bird. I thought then: maybe, Water Spirit? Ran chills over the skin from all this. I stopped fearing any living creature long ago, but here... Basically, I quickly moved the transmitter and antenna to another place again and left there. But shortly before you and Karina arrived, again the same song.
Some devilry.

That's what I'm saying... So, Strelok, I beg you very much, go there, maybe at least you manage to find the reason. Find out who or what is constantly breaking my antenna. Yes, and take the transmitter from there, I'm tired of all this mysticism. Better arrange with Grig and put it at the Wanderers' checkpoint. Although the signal is not very good there, I'll be calmer. I'll send the mark where my antenna is installed to your PDA.
Okay, Doc. Will go, look what's what and bring your device. Put mark in PDA. I'll be quick.
I returned, Doc. And you were right when assumed it could be a Water Spirit...
Didn't understand you, Strelok. What do you mean?
That in the place where your receiver was installed, a family of real Water Spirits settled. Creepy creatures, I tell you... Almost invisible. Instead of blood some acid splashes. Horror.
So that's it... How many more miracles does the Zone prepare for us? Well okay. Brought the device?
Yes. Here is your device, take it.
So what, Doc, now your guide will lead me to the transition to Dead City?

Yes, of course, Strelok. Now you can go. The guide will take you. Just remember, to find the way back from Army Warehouses to Swamps... And this path will be useful to you yet, I am sure of it. You will need to talk to Pathfinder. Here, pass this flash drive to him from me, he will understand everything and show you the way back. That's all. And now, as they say, run after the "White Rabbit". My dog is waiting for you in the yard near the house. He will take you to the place where the path starts. Look, protect him, so he doesn't get into anything. This is a very valuable dog. I picked him up as a puppy, cured him and raised him into a guide, an unsurpassed seeker of "Secret Paths".
Understood, Doc. Will definitely visit Pathfinder and pass the flash drive to him. All right, I'm going. See you!
Goodbye, Strelok. Go with God!
Hi, Pathfinder!
What did you want, Strelok?
Doctor passed something for you here.
You were at Doctor's on Swamps? How did you get there?
Long story. Ended up there by accident. Was rescuing one person from trouble. Doctor passes some flash drive to you. Here, take it.
Give it. Let's see what's there... Aha, clear. So, and what else did he pass?
He also said that you can show me the secret path from Army Warehouses to Swamps through Dead City. I just came here by it. But to the return end...

Well, since Doctor said, means I'll help you. Especially since this path is very, very convenient and will surely be useful. But there is one "but". You can open this path only with the help of one very rare artifact, which bears the name "Superconductor". It was named "Superconductor" for its ability to shift space for a long time and thereby create spatial corridors, so-called "Secret Paths", with the help of which one can move along previously inaccessible routes. Differs from its "younger brothers", conductors of lower order, in that it activates transitions along several routes at once. To activate, just pick up this artifact. One but: finding this artifact is extremely difficult. It appears in a short period of time, approximately during one hour, somewhere between one and two o'clock at night. If you don't find it during this time, the artifact disappears. So that's how it is...
Ve-ery interesting. Will try to find this superconductor. The path is painfully important. Will surely be useful in the future. Suggest at least approximate place where it can be found.

Well, since the path it should open starts at Warehouses, means need to search at Warehouses. In other places, in the Zone, I met it only once. As you probably guessed - on Swamps. Where exactly to look at Warehouses is hard to say, but I think in hard-to-reach places. Just remember, %c[red]time for its search is limited to only one hour: between one and two o'clock at night.%c[default] If you find it, drag it to me. Will open the transition from Warehouses to Swamps through Dead City for you. Yes, and also: %c[red]You will have three days for the search, maximum four.%c[default] Then for a whole month there will be extremely unfavorable conditions for its appearance. So don't drag with time.
Everything is clear to me. Yes, not a simple task, but I solved harder ones. So I will definitely find "Superconductor" and bring it to you so you open the path to Swamps.
Hi, Pathfinder!
What business, Strelok?
I found the "Superconductor"! Here.
Wow! You really are an experienced seeker. Let's see where the path interesting to us starts at Warehouses.
Hold.
What business do you have, Barkeep?

While you were away, Sidorovich and I fully agreed on how to pull off one big deal. Few details left and that's it. All past discords between him and me are in the past now. Now we are partners. Basically, Strelok, your help will be needed. If everything works out, you will receive a very large reward for your labors.
And what is required of me?

I can't tell you all details yet, but one of the important conditions for our business is support of Duty members. I almost agreed on everything with Voronin. Now we need to meet Sidorovich personally. The meeting is scheduled for the nearest time on the territory of Station "Glubokoe", in the abandoned village. Sid will surely come with security. I also need a person I can trust to be nearby. You are the best candidate for me.
That is, I must escort you to the meeting with Sidorovich. Right?

Yes, right. But first I will ask you to carry an encrypted note to Voronin and give it to him personally in hands. We'll go to the territory of Station "Glubokoe" secretly and separately. Don't meddle through Peacekeepers Checkpoint. They shouldn't guess anything. So you will go to Station "Glubokoe" through Dark Valley. Voronin will show you the secret path there when you give him my message. And I'll go my own way. I know one short path to Peacekeepers. We'll meet there, not far from the abandoned village. I'll let you know where exactly. When you cross from Dark Valley to Peacekeepers territory, I'll drop a message to your PDA. Understood everything?
Yes, everything is clear. Give the letter, and I'm off to Voronin.
General. I came to you from Barkeep with an encryption.
Glad to see you, Strelok. You are just like a reconnaissance spy, carrying encryptions.
That's Barkeep. Keeps encrypting: Business, he says, is very secret, and no one should know anything.

Ye-eah, they started a grandiose business with Sidorovich. It just so happened that our interest is in this business too. So a large number of people will be involved. And for the time being no one should know anything, otherwise it will be a failure.
I understand everything, that's why I don't interfere with questions. Here, take the message from Barkeep. By the way, Barkeep said you will show me the path from Dark Valley to Peacekeepers.
Yes, I'll show. Give PDA, will mark the place where the transition to peacekeepers territory starts.
Here is PDA. Mark and I'm moving out.
Well, Barkeep, where are we going?
Right nearby here. Follow me. While we talk with Sid, don't eavesdrop. As we finish, I'll tell you what to do next. Is everything clear?
Yes, everything clear. Let's go.
Well, agreed on everything?
Yes, now all i's are dotted. Everything will be decided soon.
What are the further actions?

Listen to me carefully. Sid and I need to chat about something else face to face. And you must go to Voronin again and pass him one more letter, the last one. It has final instructions, as they say, safe houses-passwords for our common business. Then I myself will go to Duty guys, but later. And Sidorovich will take my place in the bunker at Cordon. This is the first stage of our plan. After you give the message to Voronin, he will pass you an answer for Sidorovich. Sid will be at Cordon by that time. You'll carry the answer to him, and he will say what to do next. Comprehended?
Yes, everything clear. Gone to Voronin.
Greetings to you, General.
Well, Strelok, how are things?

Everything seems fine. Barkeep met with Sidorovich. I gathered they finally discussed all details. Here, Barkeep passes one more encryption on your common business. Says, as you read, write an answer for Sidorovich. Sidorovich is moving to Cordon now, and Barkeep said he will come to you soon.
Well, give the message. Let's see what those sly faces invented there.
Here is the letter, General.
So-so, let's see what Barkeep writes... Aha, look how they propose... Clear, clear. Okay, let's try this way... Strelok, here is my answer for Sidorovich. Carry it to him at Cordon.
Come on, General. Will carry.
Hi, Sidorovich! New shop, congratulations!
Thank you. Just dealing with goods right now. Doing audit, so to speak. And wouldn't hurt to clean up here. In a couple of days can start trading... Did you bring the answer from Voronin?
Yes, of course. Here is the letter.
So-so. Let's see what our brave General writes... We-ell, very good! Voronin gives go-ahead and ready to start. Well, means time of great achievements has come.
So, does it mean I did my job? Barkeep promised a worthy reward.
Wait, Strelok. The job is not done yet. The hardest part is ahead. And we really need your help.
And what else is required of me?

Okay, will reveal our cards to you so you understand the whole importance of the moment. Barkeep and I used to feud heavily over zones of influence. He always said I lure his clients, lower prices on goods and so on. I, in turn, also had a mass of claims to him. Became unbearable to work in such spirit further, and Barkeep made the first step and proposed the following: I move here, to Cordon, and engage in honest trade at his old place. Part of his clients automatically switch to me. He, in turn, wanted very much to move to the Bar. But, as you know, thugs have been running things there for a long time. And here Barkeep invented a sly exit.
And what is it? Bandits sit very tight in the Bar.

That's the difficulty. But only recently a new warlike faction Duty appeared, which would very much like to make a powerful base on the Bar territory. But alone they can't overcome bandits yet. Barkeep didn't have connections among Duty members then to come out to them with a proposal to unite efforts. And I happened to be a supplier of provisions for Voronin and his fighters and had certain respect with them. Barkeep asked me to introduce him to Voronin. I did it. We three talked and decided to act together. Barkeep organizes secret movement of Duty strike squad to the northern deserted territory of the Bar, and I organize a diversionary maneuver, set mercenaries on the southern checkpoint of the Bar. Bandits, of course, will lay down mercs, but mercs will batter them good too. And just then sudden strike from the north and capture of the Bar by Duty members. After which Barkeep occupies his rightful place in the Bar.
Look what you stirred up. Ho-o-oly cow... Bold, can't say anything. And what help can be from me?

And you, Strelok, are virtually a key figure in this case. Missing a small detail to execute the plan. For successful attack a detailed map of the Bar is needed. But there is no one to get it or draw. And you, as far as we know, have a decent reputation with the Thugs, right? So we ask you to get the map of the Bar and pass it to the commander of the assault squad. And so that thugs in the Bar respect you even more, you will just slightly help them overcome mercenaries at the southern checkpoint.
You guys are dragging me into some scam! Well, okay, and where will I get a map in the Bar? Or do you propose I measure everything and draw it?

Just listen first. The plan is sure. We thought through everything to the details. Borov has the map, that's for sure. After you help defend the southern checkpoint from mercs, propose to Borov to strengthen both checkpoints to secure from further similar dangers. Say that you have familiar guys, former builders, specialists in fortifications, who will organize everything in best form and cheaply. Bandits themselves will never do anything, but if proposed such, they will agree with joy. They are thugs, but not fools. And to do everything correctly and wisely, ask Borov for a detailed map of the territory, on which you allegedly need to put necessary measurements and calculate everything in detail. He will give you the map with joy.
Okay, persuaded. Will try to help you. Hope the reward will be worthy.

Well, that's great! Means agreed. Now go to the Bar, and I'll inform Barkeep to give go-ahead to Duty members. When you take the map, exit through northern checkpoint and to the right, to transition to Warehouses. A Duty squad will wait for you there in ambush. Give the map to the commander, and then... Well, and then an extra gun won't hurt them.

What am I getting into, huh? Well okay. Cannot die twice, cannot avoid one death. Only I have good acquaintances left in the Bar. Should warn them, because, as I understand, there will be a devilish meat grinder. What if in confusion they get it too.

Strelok, if you are about Count and Pathfinder, you can not worry. They are aware of affairs. It is with the help of Count's trick we managed to set mercenaries on the southern checkpoint. Come on, hurry, time doesn't wait. If you have any business left with them, don't delay. Unlikely you will be able to find these guys in the bar later.
Clear, moving out.
Something else?
Yes. One person stopped by here, was looking for you.
What person?
Pleasant surprise! He is probably already waiting for you at the entrance to my bunker.
Okay. I like surprises.
Something else?
Yes, Strelok. My intelligence reported that you treated Peacekeepers badly: Stole some body armor from them. And it came out sideways for my old buddy... Mahomet.
Wow! And I'm looking for him... And what happened?

After you stole armor from Peacekeepers, terrible fuss rose there. They put ambushes everywhere. And Mahomet was just walking to me by secret path from Dark Valley. Well, by the one I told you about. And you, apparently, brought a tail to the transition. Get it?
Yes, I get it... Only I had no other choice then!

Choice always exists, Strelok. You just didn't want to think. Because of this a good man died. Peacekeepers killed him... He ran into their ambush and got a bullet in the forehead. They were waiting for you there, but Mahomet got caught accidentally.
Damn... Pity Mahomet. Forgive me. And now I won't find the brother.
Hello... And who are you?
I am Mahomet. Didn't expect to meet me here, Strelok?
Holy cow! What a meeting! How long I searched for you, Mahomet!
They told you I'd find you myself. So I found. Well, tell, why did you search for me?

On a very important matter for me, Mahomet. I'm looking for my brother. Called Captain. Several years ago he was in that very group which first attempted to get to the CNPP territory, into the Sarcophagus. Together with him were several other brave stalkers, including Yuri Semetsky. And I have information that you met Semetsky alive and unharmed. So, if Semetsky remained alive, then, possibly, my brother is alive too. Because then only they two from the whole group went inside the sarcophagus... Tell what you know on this matter.

So that's it, Strelok! Actually no one believes me that I met alive Semetsky. But this is pure truth. And I met him twice. First time it was about year and a half ago. Then I saw him briefly in the Forest on Radar. He looked, let's say, not very good. Either zombie or human - couldn't make out. But it was definitely him, I'm sure of it. There, in the Forest, were plenty of anomalies and mutants, and he disappeared somewhere quickly.
And the second time when?

Second time quite recently, about two months ago. It was near Pripyat, in abandoned hospital. I just led a small group of stalkers to Pripyat and was returning through hospital to Yantar. That's where I met him... Yes, a sight not for faint-hearted. Little human left in him, walking corpse. He didn't let me close. Muttered something about "Monolith". About that he has long been a hostage of some "dark forces" and his own stupidity. Also said that he must fulfill his mission - destroy this "devil stone". Basically, some delirium... Yes, as it seemed to me, he wasn't talking to me at all, but to himself. But in any case, if you want to figure out what actually happened many years ago with your brother, you need to find Semetsky and somehow try to talk to him. Only he will be able to help you.
Ye-eah, story... Where do you think one can find him?
I think at CNPP, in Sarcophagus. As I understood from his words, he was going exactly there. To fulfill some delirious mission of his.
In Sarcophagus, then... Yeah, rotten place. But nothing to be done. Have to go. Just will finish one business and go. Maybe I'll get lucky, and find out something...
Well then, good luck to you, Strelok. Glad to meet you.
Thank you for everything, Mahomet. And see you.
Hi, Barkeep! Well, everything seems normal.
Strelok, buddy, you helped us very much. Thank you!
Well, thank you won't feed you...
You offend me. I didn't forget that promised to reward you generously. Here, take. From all of us for your invaluable help one hundred thousand money and a machine gun.
O-oh, truly generous. Thank you!
Hello, sister!
And you are incorrigible, Strelok. Still being rude.
Come on! Zombies destroyed. Life is getting better!
Thank you, Strelok, for helping us get rid of zombies once again. We are leaving the Dead City.
Why so? Did something happen?
No, just became too dangerous here. City became not so "dead" now. These zombies constantly climbing... Basically, we are leaving. Enough for us.
Clear. But it seems to me matter is not in zombies and not in dangers. Something else here, right?

Yes, you are right, Strelok, matter is in something else... We are leaving the Zone completely. That's it, enough for us... Now can tell you the truth. We were looking for a very rare artifact here - "Wind Rose". This artifact could help thousands of people get rid of a terrible disease, but we never found it... Apparently it doesn't exist. All were legends. So farewell. Don't hold a grudge, if anything. And I have absolutely nothing to reward you with for help...
Come on. Don't worry, sister. Farewell, time for me to go further.
I came for my brother!
Your brother is not here, human. There is only enlightened mind freed from everything superfluous and mundane. Mind capable of creating miracles and ruling the world.
Brother! I know you are there... You are inside. Fight! They captured your mind! But you are human! Fight!

Stupid monkey... You can change nothing! Step away and don't interfere. I propose you to watch and enjoy the great spectacle before death. Soon we start our performance. Not long left now. It will be a grandiose show, triumph of the power of freed mind!
Brother, Wake up! Wake up, Captain! I know you hear me. It's me, Strelok!
Don't waste strength in vain before death, human. Better relax and enjoy the great and grandiose spectacle. Today the World will become different.
I didn't walk here for so long to be a dull observer and give up so simply! I learned a lot. Here, catch! This is "Wind Rose". Greetings from Semetsky!
Brother, it's you!
Strelok! Kid, you found me... How glad I am to see you! How did you manage?
Brother, about this later. I also have a mass of questions for you. But now must get out of here faster.

Kid, I'm too weak to go anywhere now. Head... My head... Like a cast-iron bell... Legs... legs like cotton... Listen to me, brother: practically no time. The fact that you managed to free me from this captivity essentially changes nothing... The process of Zone rebirth is already launched. You just delayed its beginning a little. Go alone, save yourself! And my place, looks like, is here after all... Go, brother! One of us must remain alive and get out of this cursed Zone! Not far here, at northern gates, there is a transition to CNPP-2. From there I think you'll find the way. At least, I hope for it very much.

No, Captain, I won't leave you! Listen to me now: I have an individual one-time teleporter, which from any place of the Zone can throw one person to Swamps to Doctor. So the layout is this: you take the device and teleport to Doctor. You need his help oh so much right now. And I will come a bit later. I will get out, don't worry. In the end, I got here, means can get back too.
Kid, you don't understand what and whom you are dealing with! They won't let you leave so simply, believe me. I know what I'm saying. Practically no time.
Captain, let's not waste precious minutes! Take the teleporter and blow to Doctor, and I'm on my own. Don't worry! I'll be quick.

Kid, and you grew up... You are not that young romantic you were before. You became an adult man, a warrior. I see fire in your eyes. Okay, let it be as you propose. But only I beg you, don't get involved in anything. Just run and don't look back. Transition to CNPP-2, as I said, somewhere at northern gates. Oh, my heart feels, they won't let you pass just like that. Okay, give teleporter and let's go. God keep you, Kid! Absolutely no time left. Soon will begin...
Here. Take the individual teleporter and see you, brother.
How can this be???
And hello again! Unexpected, yes? And we warned: shouldn't waste strength and energy on dubious activities. Did you really think that here, in the Zone, you can make decisions and act independently?
I always make decisions myself and act as my mind and heart tell me!
We have another opinion on this account... Well okay. You freed the brother. That's good. Well done! It was intended so. You delayed the Great Emission for some time. There is nothing scary in this.
What do you mean "it was intended so"?

And it means that you proved your great power once again. True, you turned out insufficiently agile to run away from us. But that is good! And your brother... Your brother is not needed to us anymore. He worked out his resource...\nNOW YOU WILL TAKE HIS PLACE!
No-o-o-o!
Good day! I understand you are Sorcerer?
Understanding correctly, stalker. What brought you to me?
One person told me that you can revive the dead. I don't particularly believe in it, but dropped by to find out for interest sake.

You weren't deceived. It is really so. This is the ZONE, and there are so many miracles in it you never dreamed of. Practically any person who died within limits of anomalous activity of the Zone, I can return to life, or rather create his clone. True, it won't be quite a human anymore, but a zombie. But most importantly his mind and memory for some time will be in the state they were before his death.
Is it really possible? But how?

How - is not your worry. I was "on the other side of the world" and returned from there with such knowledge. So, if you want to return a dead man to this world, I am ready to help you. Only it won't be cheap. Cost of my labors is one hundred thousand rubles. And also: Resurrect a person by your request will be possible only in case if not you killed him. Clear?
I understood everything. If suddenly I need to return someone to life, even for a while, I will definitely contact you.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Lapsha".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Lapsha" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Skinflint".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Skinflint" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Screw".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Screw" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Lukash".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Lukash" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Dan".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Dan" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Lefty".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Lefty" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased named Sviblov.

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return Sviblov to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Sorcerer, I need to return to life deceased nicknamed "Snitch".

Well then, knew such one. Give one hundred thousand and I return "Snitch" to this world. He will appear right here, nearby, so don't get scared. For some time he will be a bit "out of it", but not for long. Already in a couple of minutes you'll be able to talk to him normally.
Eh, don't have enough money. Going to collect.
Agreed. Here, take money.
Hi, Screw!
And you too don't fall ill, Strelok. What business to me?
Yes, want to charge the homemade flamethrower from Baker.
Well, let's try, but you understand yourself, not for free.
And what do you ask for work?

Well, first, you need a fireball to charge the flamethrower. Second, my fee is a modest reward - two bottles of vodka and 10,000 cash. Deal? If yes, bring me everything on the list and you'll get your mixture.
Well, I won't haggle. Here you go.
I'll come back later.
Sobered up, Vano?
Eh, dea-ar! From where know me? What is your name?
The whole Zone talks only about you, that Vano is the most notorious drunkard and brawler. Worthless person. And my name is Strelok.
Hey, Strelok! Why you say so bad about Vano, huh? What bad did I do to you? Vano is kind and cheerful. Vano offends no one.

Just look at your drunk face! You'll croak soon if you don't quit boozing. Baker is a good man, worries about you, and you let him down. Look, he can't even entrust any serious business to you. You lost his trust.
Come on, friend. Vano controls situation. Vano is good man. Vano soon will go to "Freedom" guys. There Vano will be like at home. But here Vano is bored...
They won't let you within a kilometer there! Bullet in the forehead and done. Freedom guys are serious and won't let any rubbish in.
Vano is not rubbish! Vano is scout. Vano tracked marauders who hung around here for whole week. And Vano learned something important.
And what so important was Vano able to learn?

And you don't laugh. Vano pursued marauders from Peacekeepers base itself. Marauders stole a box with mines from Peacekeepers and carried it to abandoned village. But only didn't reach there... Swamp creature ate them a little on the swamp... If Vano had assault rifle, then Vano would deal with them himself. But so Vano only hid and watched how they ran from there, abandoning the looted.
So need to go pick up that box and return to Peacekeepers. They are generous guys, will give good reward.

No-no. Peacekeepers evil. They once treated Vano badly. Vano doesn't love them. Vano proposes this: you walk with such gun, and Vano has no weapon. And Vano afraid and little sick now... Therefore go to swamp, pick up box from there and bring it to Vano. Vano will take this box and carry to Freedom guys. For this they will respect Vano and take to them. So, will you bring? And Vano won't stay in debt. Vano will give you part of mines from that box. Vano honest man.
Okay, hell with you. Give the mark where approximately to search for the box there. Maybe I'll go.

That is good! Everything simple. Swamp is very close here. Vano will put mark on map for you. Need to search for box in the swamp itself. It's shallow, near broken helicopter. Just look out, Strelok, be careful there. And on way back be attentive too. Marauders hang around here constantly. Although they are cowardly creatures, but there are many of them. That makes them dangerous.
Put mark. Will try to find box with mines in swamp.
Enough boozing, Vano! You'll croak soon from vodka.
Yes... You are right, stalker. Must quit drinking...
I found the box with mines in the swamp. Ran into marauders on the way back. But nothing, dealt with them. Warded off trouble from you and Baker.
Wah, dear! Well done! Give it to me quickly! If you want, we can mine the whole base of these Peacekeeper bastards. Will be fun to watch how scum fly into air!
No, thanks for "wise" advice, but you deal with Peacekeepers yourself, only I don't advise you. Okay, hold the box with mines.
So? Recovered, darling?
Ah you, basement rats! Cowardly creatures! Only know how to sneak from behind!

And you don't fume here much, stalker! Fact that you are still alive only because we have important question for you. As you probably already noticed, your loot is with us. Want to return your things back peacefully? Well, of course, except that box you pulled from swamp and which belongs to us.
If you, lice, met me face to face, would see then who is who...
Look at you! Half step from death, and demanding rights. Fearless hero, or what? Huh?
Goats!
You answered for goats... Will you continue being hero further?
Ah you, reptile! Okay... Ending the chat. What do you need from me?

Now that's another matter. So, listen here: I understand, you sort of can pass freely to Peacekeepers base, right? Yes, know for sure. So, go and bring us two Peacekeepers body armors SKAT-11M from there. Bring - get your things back from Gena. And Gena will guard them for now, don't worry. Body armors should lie in warehouse, warehouse opposite toilet, won't get lost. Here is key to warehouse, don't ask where I got it. Don't think Peacekeepers will let you go just like that if they see you stole armors from them. So here is my advice: after taking body armors, find how to exit base another way. There is a loophole, otherwise Peacekeepers will shoot you. And you, I think, don't really want to quarrel with them. But that's your problems. And don't think of playing games with us, you'll regret!
Okay, rat. Will bring what you ask. Guard my things and weapon.

Go already, darling, work. And more. Don't think of meddling to Baker anymore. Kill on spot. He is our "client". We watch him for long time. Soon a parcel should come to him. Then we will utilize him. So, if you think of warning him, death to you.
Yes I understood everything. Wait. I'll be soon.
So, hero? Brought two SKAT-11M body armors?
Brought.
That is good. Give them here.
And where are my weapon and things?
I said - Gena guards them. Give armors here!
Okay. Here are body armors, take them. Now give my things and weapon.
What a loser you are, boy!
Didn't understand...
Greetings, General! I have business for you.
Speak, Strelok. What business?
I got captured by marauders in abandoned village. Stripped me to the thread. Took everything: weapon and things.
Unlucky you, stalker. Good that they let you go alive at least.

General, to return my things and weapon, marauders ordered me to get two body suits SKAT-11M. Steal them from your base and bring to them. But I don't want to do this, that's why came to you for help.
You are an honest man, Strelok! How exactly can I help you?
Give me assault rifle, ammo, five grenades and a couple of fighters, and we will take out the whole marauder village.

Well, Strelok, can't allocate people to you now. We have one important operation planned in the south of territory, so every barrel counts. But assault rifle, ammo for it, couple of grenades, medkit with bandages and that very body armor I will give you. I think you'll handle marauders yourself. Agreed?
Agreed, General. Give. It will be even more pleasant for me to deal with them alone and return my things and weapon. Thank you very much! Going to deal with these rats.
